moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Nf6 4. Ng5 d5: This move has always had me undecided on what to do.
moves.6. Bb5+ Bd7 7. Bxd7+ Qxd7 8. Nc3 Be7: I get to keep the pawn.
moves.9. Qf3 O-O 10. d3 h6: This is where I went into my loosely held together position.
moves.11. Nge4 Nxd5 12. Nxd5: At this point he chatted, "good one!" Notice how he can't take the knight!
moves.12... f5 13. Bxh6: !! He can't take it because of Nef6+ Bxf6, Nxf6 and he looses his queen.
moves.16. Bxg7: ? I should have played Qxe5 followed by Nf6+
moves.19... Bxb4 20. Ne6+: ? Should have taken on a8 and make him move his rook into he corner.
Pointless, I needed to push my king side pawns.
moves.29. h4 Nf5 30. Rf1: ???? I thought I was winning a piece with a skewer.
moves.30... Ng3+: I resigned. there was no way I could queen a pawn with his Bishop there.
